text: Back in March, Disney posted the global casting call for the upcoming live-action remake of Aladdin. The studio was looking for its two leads in the musical, based on the 1992 animated movie. The notice called for actors aged 18-25, with the ability to sing (dance experience a plus), to play the Middle Eastern characters (thought it did not specify that the actors had to be Middle Eastern). According to a new report from The Hollywood Reporter , it's been a much harder process than anyone imagined. Four months later, they still haven't found their stars, and filming has been pushed from July to August.
